reviews.review_msg: He is a very nice and friendly guy. He knows his stuff, but his teaching is confusing and all over the place. He is unorganized and you will do well if you just read the textbook. His tests and assignments are not too hard.
Nice and knowledgeable guy but terrible at teaching. Seriously not recommended, useless class. Content not overly difficult, so you are better off with reading the book on your own.

This guy's really nice, but makes mistakes everywhere - can be a bit difficult to follow.  Has a tendency to go off on long tangents and then run out of class-time.  His class is fun, though, especially if it's just a few students.  His tests usually let you pick 4 or 5 questions out of 7 or 8, which makes them much easier.

Really nice guy, but he's a terrible professor. I was hoping for a class on Programming Languages, given the name of the course and all, but instead got a class on abstract math. I'm used to that at this point, but the fact that he was too confused to continue his lectures most of the time made it pretty hard to take. Sign up with a different prof.

Boring, unclear, makes plenty of mistakes in his lecture notes, messy lecture notes.
 AVOID!!!!!!!

He is the worst of the worst! Avoid him by all means. His lectures make you more confused. His writing is messy and he often makes mistakes. It's better to read the textbook on your own. He is very unorganized and unclear. There's no homework for 1 month and 2 homework in 6 days. He should be fired.
one of the weirdest teacher i've known, maybe he's smart but he doesnt know how to teach...His lectures are all over the place, I dont konw what he's talking about....bottom line, sucks
Worse professor I've ever had in my entire life.  He definitely knows his stuffs, but does not know how to teach...at all.
Generally a good guy, but makes many many mistakes when he teaches
Super easy tests.goes on&on&off topic.quote: urhhh  often  hangs  like computers
He bailed on the class after spending 2 weeks talking about admin.
Be prepared to master Haskell.  Not the hottest skill in the world.
This guy spent the first 3 classes talking about his e-mail policies.
